article_title: Senate Approves Suspension of U.S. Debt Ceiling
article_text:
WASHINGTON—Legislation to extend the government's borrowing authority cleared Congress on Wednesday, ending a laborious debate that exposed divisions among Republicans, and putting the debt-limit fight to rest for more than a year.

The bill was sent to the White House, where President Barack Obama was expected to sign it, after the Senate voted 55-43 along party lines to approve a suspension of the federal debt limit through March...

twitter.description: The Senate voted 55-43 along party lines to extend the government's borrowing authority until March 2015, sending the measure to President Barack Obama for his expected signature.
twitter.creator: @hookjan

image.alt: Senate approves suspension of U.S. debt ceiling
